action.action-desc: Ms. Tenney (for herself and Mr. Higgins of Louisiana) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the FAST Act to modify eligibility requirements for participation in a commercial driver pilot program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Waiving Hindrances to Economic Enterprise and Labor Act or the WHEEL Act.
Section 5404(f)(4) of the FAST Act (Public Law 114–94; 49 U.S.C. 31315 note) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The term covered driver means an individual who—

subparagraph.text: is between the ages of 18 and 21;
holds a valid commercial driver’s license;
has a driving record without citations, violations, or other safety infractions; and

has received a certification of completion of a training program or similar qualification, as determined appropriate by the Secretary, demonstrating skill and aptitude with respect to the operation of a commercial motor vehicle.
